Title: show that $\frac{1}{F_{1}}+\frac{2}{F_{2}}+\cdots+\frac{n}{F_{n}}<13$
Content:
Let $F_{n}$ is Fibonacci number,ie.($F_{n}=F_{n-1}+F_{n-2},F_{1}=F_{2}=1$) show that
$$\dfrac{1}{F_{1}}+\dfrac{2}{F_{2}}+\cdots+\dfrac{n}{F_{n}}<13$$ if we use 
Closed-form expression
$$F_{n}=\dfrac{1}{\sqrt{5}}\left(\left(\dfrac{1+\sqrt{5}}{2}\right)^n-\left(\dfrac{1-\sqrt{5}}{2}\right)^n\right)$$
$$\dfrac{n}{F_{n}}=\dfrac{\sqrt{5}n}{\left(\left(\dfrac{1+\sqrt{5}}{2}\right)^n-\left(\dfrac{1-\sqrt{5}}{2}\right)^n\right)}$$ Well and now I'm stuck and don't know how to proceed
llm_answer_create_structured_problem:
###BEGIN_OF_FORMAT###
Assumption: 
$F_n$ is the Fibonacci sequence,
$F_1 = 1$,
$F_2 = 1$,
For each integer $n \geq 3$, $F_n = F_{n-1} + F_{n-2}$,
$F_n$ has the closed-form expression $F_n = \dfrac{1}{\sqrt{5}}\left(\left(\dfrac{1+\sqrt{5}}{2}\right)^n - \left(\dfrac{1-\sqrt{5}}{2}\right)^n\right)$,
$n$ is a positive integer.
Problem:
Show that $$\dfrac{1}{F_{1}} + \dfrac{2}{F_{2}} + \cdots + \dfrac{n}{F_{n}} < 13.$$
###
